content.prompt:
​

The graph consists of 9 plotted points connected by line segments. The plotted points have the following coordinates, in sequence:

  • (negative 4 comma negative 2)
  • (negative 3 comma negative 2)
  • (negative 2 comma negative 2)
  • (negative 1 comma negative 1)
  • (0 comma negative 1)
  • (1 comma negative 1)
  • (2 comma 0)
  • (3 comma 1)
  • (4 comma 2)

 

​The piecewise-linear function f{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}, defined on -4≤x≤4{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}, is shown in the graph. The function g{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} is given by gx=x+3{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}. Which of the following is the graph of y=fgx{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} ?

choices.label:
​

The graph consists of 9 plotted points connected by line segments. The plotted points have the following coordinates, in sequence:

  • (negative 7 comma negative 2)
  • (negative 6 comma negative 2)
  • (negative 5 comma negative 2)
  • (negative 4 comma negative 1)
  • (negative 3 comma negative 1)
  • (negative 2 comma negative 1)
  • (negative 1 comma 0)
  • (0 comma 1)
  • (1 comma 2)

​

The graph consists of 6 plotted points connected by line segments. The plotted points have the following coordinates, in sequence:

  • (negative 4 comma negative 1)
  • (negative 3 comma negative 1)
  • (negative 2 comma negative 1)
  • (negative 1 comma 0)
  • (0 comma 1)
  • (1 comma 2)

​

The graph consists of 9 plotted points connected by line segments. The plotted points have the following coordinates, in sequence:

  • (negative 1 comma negative 2)
  • (0 comma negative 2)
  • (1 comma negative 2)
  • (2 comma negative 1)
  • (3 comma negative 1)
  • (4 comma negative 1)
  • (5 comma 0)
  • (6 comma 1)
  • (7 comma 2)

​

The graph consists of 9 plotted points connected by line segments. The plotted points have the following coordinates, in sequence:

  • (negative 4 comma 1)
  • (negative 3 comma 1)
  • (negative 2 comma 1)
  • (negative 1 comma 2)
  • (0 comma 2)
  • (1 comma 2)
  • (2 comma 3)
  • (3 comma 4)
  • (4 comma 5)

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
